00026 //external variables to get additional info of parsing results by getopt()/getopt_long()/getopt_long_only() LINUX/GNU API
00027 #define GETOPT_API_ARGUMENT_PTR    (optarg)
00028 #define GETOPT_API_NEXT_TOKEN_POS (optind)
00029 #define GETOPT_API_RETURNED_ERROR (opterr)
00030 #define GETOPT_API_FAILED_FOR_OPTION_INDEX (optopt)

00036   BpInterconnect::OptionsDescriptor::OptionsDescriptor(const option opts[], size_t numOpts, int *flag_ptr, const char *optstring, bool appendHelp) : 
00037     m_options(opts, opts+numOpts), 
00038     m_short_options(optstring),
00039     m_legal_lengths(appendHelp ? numOpts+1 : numOpts) 
00040   {
00041     for(unsigned i = 0; i < numOpts; i++)
00042       m_options[i].flag = flag_ptr;
00043 
00044     if (appendHelp)
00045     {
00046       m_options.push_back(m_HelpOption);
00047       m_legal_lengths.back().insert(strlen("h")); //-h[elp]
00048     }
00049     m_options.push_back(m_NULL); //NULL struct terminator is mandatory for getopt_long API
00050   }
00051 
00052   const bool BpInterconnect::OptionsDescriptor::IsLegalAbbreviation(int option_index, string& abbreviatedOption)
00053   {
00054     size_t length = abbreviatedOption.length();
00055     size_t post_dash = abbreviatedOption.find_first_not_of('-');
00056     if (post_dash != string::npos)
00057       length -= post_dash;
00058 
00059     if ( length  == strlen(m_options[option_index].name) )
00060       return true;
00061 
00062     if (m_legal_lengths[option_index].find(length) != m_legal_lengths[option_index].end()) //this length is legal abbreviation
00063       return true;
00064 
00065     return false;
00066   }

00070   }

00072   BpInterconnect::BpCommandOptionsBase::parse_status BpInterconnect::BpCommandOptionsBase::ParseCheckSyntax(const string& command_with_arguments)
00073   {
00074     parse_status status = SUCCESS;
00075 
00076     m_tokens.clear();
00077     m_supplied_options.clear();
00078     GetTokens(command_with_arguments, m_tokens);
00079     
00080     if (m_tokens.size() > 1)
00081     {
00082       try
00083       {
00084         int opt = DoParseLoop(); 
00085         status = HandleParseEndCondition(opt);
00086         if (status == PARSE_FAILURE)
00087           DebugTrace("Parsing of predefined command %s failed", m_command->Name().c_str());
00088       }
00089       catch(int)
00090       {
00091         _ParsingError("fatal error on parsing command line");
00092         return PARSE_FAILURE;
00093       }
00094     }
00095 
00096     if (status == SUCCESS)
00097        status = m_command->QueryOptionsConsistency() ? SUCCESS : PARSE_FAILURE;
00098 
00099     return status;
00100   }
00101   
00102   //resetting internal mechanism of getopt() GNU LINUX API to get prepared for new command parsing
00103   int BpInterconnect::BpCommandOptionsBase::InitializeGetopt(char* const* argv,  OptionsDescriptorBase *options)
00104   {
00105     int dummy_index;
00106 
00107     GETOPT_API_NEXT_TOKEN_POS = 0;     //zero means this is the first call; initialize.
00108     int opt = getopt_long(1, argv,  options->GetShortOptionsString(), options->GetLongOptionsPtr(0), &dummy_index); 
00109     GETOPT_API_RETURNED_ERROR = 0; //getopt() called on pos=0 returns error, but consistently resets to initial parsing state for new parsing
00110 
00111     return GETOPT_API_NEXT_TOKEN_POS;//=1: positioned on the first m_options[1] token (next after command itself)
00112   }
00113 
00114 
00115   int BpInterconnect::BpCommandOptionsBase::DoParseLoop()
00116   {
00117     vector<const char *> argv;
00118     transform (m_tokens.begin(), m_tokens.end(), back_inserter(argv), const_mem_fun_ref_t<const char *, string>(&string::c_str));
00119     OptionsDescriptorBase *options = GetOptions();
00120     m_supplied_options = vector<bool>(options->Size(), false);
00121     int opt, dummy_index;
00122 
00123     m_last_pos = InitializeGetopt((char* const*)(argv.data()), options);
00124     
00125     while((opt = getopt_long_only((int)(m_tokens.size()), 
00126                                   (char* const*)(argv.data()), 
00127                                   options->GetShortOptionsString(), 
00128                                   options->GetLongOptionsPtr(0), 
00129                                   &dummy_index)) == 0) 
00130     {
00131       if (!m_supplied_options[m_matched_option_index])
00132       {
00133         if (!HandleTheOption(options->GetLongOptionsPtr(m_matched_option_index)->has_arg)) 
00134           return ERROR_WITH_OPTION;
00135         m_supplied_options[m_matched_option_index] = true;
00136         m_last_pos =  GETOPT_API_NEXT_TOKEN_POS;
00137       }
00138       else 
00139       {
00140         string optionStr = string("-") + options->GetLongOptionsPtr(m_matched_option_index)->name;
00141         string err = string("second occurrence of the option ") + optionStr;
00142         string err2 = string("Only one ") + optionStr + string(" option is allowed");
00143           _ParsingError(err.c_str(), err2.c_str());
00144          return DUPLICATED_OPTION;
00145      }
00146    }
00147    return opt;
00148  }
00149 
00150   bool BpInterconnect::BpCommandOptionsBase::HandleTheOption(int has_arg)
00151   {
00152     bool result = false;
00153 
00154     if (has_arg != no_argument) //any argument is exepected for the option
00155     {
00156       if (!GETOPT_API_ARGUMENT_PTR 
00157           || GETOPT_API_ARGUMENT_PTR[0] == '-') //getopt assumes the next option '-.." to be missed argument
00158       {
00159         result = m_command->MissedArgumentError(m_matched_option_index, GETOPT_API_ARGUMENT_PTR); 
00160         --GETOPT_API_NEXT_TOKEN_POS; //fix position to recover for subsequent parameter parsing
00161       }
00162       else
00163         result = m_command->SetOptionArgument(m_matched_option_index, GETOPT_API_ARGUMENT_PTR);
00164     }
00165     else //no argument required for this option flag
00166       result = m_command->SetTheOption(m_matched_option_index);
00167 
00168     if (result) 
00169     {
00170       if (!GetOptions()->IsLegalAbbreviation(m_matched_option_index, m_tokens[m_last_pos]))
00171       {
00172         //matched the option, but wrong option's abbreviation
00173         string err("illegal option abbreviation");
00174         string err2 =  string("Suggest: -")  + GetOptions()->GetLongOptionsPtr(m_matched_option_index)->name;
00175         _ParsingError(err.c_str(), err2.c_str());
00176         result = false;
00177       }
00178     }
00179     return result;
00180   }
00181 
00182   BpInterconnect::BpCommandOptionsBase::parse_status 
00183   BpInterconnect::BpCommandOptionsBase::HandleParseEndCondition(int opt)
00184   {
00185     parse_status status = PARSE_FAILURE;
00186     switch(opt)
00187     {
00188       case ERROR_WITH_OPTION:
00189       case DUPLICATED_OPTION:
00190         break;
00191       case NON_OPTION_OR_ALL_TOKENS_DONE:
00192         if (AllTokensDone())
00193           status = SUCCESS;
00194         else
00195           _PrintSyntaxOptions("unknown parameter", true);
00196         break;
00197       case HELP:
00198         status = ASKED_FOR_HELP;
00199         break;
00200       case UNKNOWN_OPTION:
00201         _PrintSyntaxOptions("unknown option", false);
00202         break;
00203       case MISSED_REQUIRED_ARGUMENT:
00204         if (m_command->MissedArgumentError(GETOPT_API_FAILED_FOR_OPTION_INDEX, GETOPT_API_ARGUMENT_PTR)) //returned SUCCESS
00205           status == SUCCESS; //means, in this case absence of the argument didn't cause parsing to fail
00206         break;
00207       default:
00208         ErrorMsg("fatal error - unknown option character \\%o'", opt);
00209         break;
00210     }
00211     return status;
00212   }
00213 
00214   bool BpInterconnect::BpCommandOptionsBase::IsSupplied(unsigned option_index)
00215   { 
00216     if (option_index < m_supplied_options.size())
00217       return m_supplied_options[option_index];
00218     return false;
00219   }

00221   string BpInterconnect::BpCommandOptionsBase::_ParsingErrorMessage(const char *err)
00222   {
00223     stringstream ss;
00224     ss << err;
00225     unsigned pos = m_last_pos;
00226     if (pos >= m_tokens.size())
00227       pos = m_tokens.size()-1;
00228 
00229     ss << " '" << m_tokens[pos] << "' at the position " << pos+1;
00230     return ss.str();
00231   }
00232 
00233   void BpInterconnect::BpCommandOptionsBase::_ParsingError(const char *err, const char *err2)
00234   {
00235     string errstr = _ParsingErrorMessage(err);
00236     if (err2)
00237       errstr += string(". ") + err2;
00238     ReportError(errstr);
00239   }
00240 
00241   void BpInterconnect::BpCommandOptionsBase::_PrintSyntaxOptions(const char *err, bool hasArgOnly)
00242   {
00243     bool headList = true;
00244     stringstream ss;
00245     string errstr = _ParsingErrorMessage(err);
00246 
00247     ss << errstr;
00248     if (hasArgOnly)
00249       ss << "\n\t\tPerhaps you meant to specify either: ";
00250     else
00251       ss << "\n\t\tThe only options allowed for this command are: ";
00252 
00253     for(unsigned i = 0; i < GetOptions()->Size(); i++)
00254     {
00255       const option *ptrOption = GetOptions()->GetLongOptionsPtr(i);
00256       if (hasArgOnly && ptrOption->has_arg == no_argument)
00257         continue;
00258       if (!headList)
00259         ss << ", ";
00260       else
00261         headList = false;
00262 
00263       ss << "-" << ptrOption->name;
00264     }
00265     if (headList == true && hasArgOnly) //no any option that requires argument
00266       ErrorMsg((errstr + "\n\t\tNo argument is expected for any of this command options").c_str());
00267     else
00268       ErrorMsg(ss.str().c_str());
00269   }
00270 
00271   void BpInterconnect::BpCommandOptionsBase::ReportError(stringstream &ss) 
00272   { 
00273     ReportError(ss.str().c_str());
00274   }

00277   void BpInterconnect::BpCommandOptionsBase::ReportError(string &msg)
00278   {
00279     ReportError(msg.c_str());
00280   }
00281 
00282   void BpInterconnect::BpCommandOptionsBase::ReportError(const char *cstr_msg)
00283   {
00284     string prefixed_msg = '"' + m_command->Name() + "\" parsing error: " + cstr_msg;
00285     ErrorMsg(prefixed_msg.c_str()); 
00286 
00287   }

00293   void BpInterconnect::BpCommandOptionsBase::GetTokens(const string &command_with_argument, vector<string> &tokens_out)
00294   {
00295     tokens_out.clear();
00296 
00297     stringstream ss(command_with_argument);
00298     ss.clear();
00299     string param;
00300     while(!ss.eof() && (ss >> param))
00301     {
00302       tokens_out.push_back(param);
00303     }
00304   }

00315   BpInterconnect::BpPrintTreeCommandOptions::BpPrintTreeCommandOptions() : m_descr(m_PrintTreeOpts, sizeof(m_PrintTreeOpts)/sizeof(option),&m_matched_option_index,(const char *)":0:1234:h")
00316   {
00317     m_descr.AddLegalLength(BpCommandPrintTree::DEPTH, strlen("d")); //-[d]epth
00318     m_descr.AddLegalLength(BpCommandPrintTree::FULL_PATH, strlen("s")); //-s
00319     m_descr.AddLegalLength(BpCommandPrintTree::FULL_PATH, strlen("short")); //-short
00320     m_descr.AddLegalLength(BpCommandPrintTree::FULL_PATH, strlen("short_path")); //-short_path[s]
00321     m_descr.AddLegalLength(BpCommandPrintTree::PORTS, strlen("p")); //-p[orts]
00322     m_descr.AddLegalLength(BpCommandPrintTree::TYPE, strlen("t")); //-t[ype]
00323     m_descr.AddLegalLength(BpCommandPrintTree::ROOT, strlen("r")); //-r[oot]

00388   BpInterconnect::BpPhaseCommandOptions::BpPhaseCommandOptions(int& mandatory_variant_selector) : 
00389     BpCommandOptionsBase(), 
00390     m_mandatory_variant(mandatory_variant_selector)
00391   {
00392     struct { 
00393       const option *opts;
00394       const size_t count;
00395       const char *optstring;
00396     } variants[] = 
00397         {
00398           { m_PhaseOpts_SA, sizeof(m_PhaseOpts_SA)/sizeof(struct option), ":01:2:3h" }, //-stop_at
00399           { m_PhaseOpts_RS, sizeof(m_PhaseOpts_RS)/sizeof(struct option), ":01:2:3h" }, //-remove_stop
00400           { m_PhaseOpts_G, sizeof(m_PhaseOpts_G)/sizeof(struct option), ":0h" },        //-get
00401           { m_PhaseOpts_LS, sizeof(m_PhaseOpts_LS)/sizeof(struct option), ":0h" },      //-list_stop
00402           { m_PhaseOpts_R, sizeof(m_PhaseOpts_R)/sizeof(struct option), ":0:h" },       //-run
00403           { NULL, 0, ":h" },                                                            //-h[elp] will be appended
00404           { m_PhaseOpts_H, sizeof(m_PhaseOpts_R)/sizeof(struct option), ":h" }          //-h different from -help for proper handling mandatory options
00405         };
00406     
00407       for(unsigned i=0; i < sizeof(variants)/sizeof(variants[0]);i++)
00408         m_variants.push_back(new OptionsDescriptor(variants[i].opts, 
00409                                                    variants[i].count, 
00410                                                    &m_matched_option_index, 
00411                                                    variants[i].optstring, 
00412                                                    (variants[i].opts != m_PhaseOpts_H))); //append -h[elp] for all but -h
00413 
00414   }
00415 
00416   BpInterconnect::BpCommandOptionsBase::match_result BpInterconnect::BpPhaseCommandOptions::MatchMandatoryOption(const string &arguments)
00417   {
00418     stringstream ss;
00419     enum match_result res = MATCH;
00420 
00421     vector<BpInterconnect::OptionsDescriptor*>::iterator it1, it2;
00422     it1 = find_if(m_variants.begin(), m_variants.end(), LookupOption(arguments));
00423     if (it1 != m_variants.end())
00424     {
00425       it2 = find_if(it1+1, m_variants.end(), LookupOption(arguments));
00426       if (it2 == m_variants.end())
00427       {
00428         m_mandatory_variant = it1 - m_variants.begin();
00429         if ((m_mandatory_variant == BpCommandPhase::HELP) || (m_mandatory_variant == BpCommandPhase::H))
00430           return HELP_OPTION;
00431         else
00432           return MATCH;
00433       }
00434       if ((it2 - m_variants.begin() == BpCommandPhase::HELP) || 
00435         (it2 - m_variants.begin() == BpCommandPhase::H))
00436           return HELP_OPTION;
00437 
00438       ss << "single action parameter required. Legal parameters (only 1 is allowed)";
00439       res = MATCH_CMD_INVALID_OPTIONS;
00440     }
00441     else
00442     {
00443       ss << "illegal parameter. Legal parameters (only 1 is allowed)";
00444       res = MATCH_CMD_INVALID_OPTIONS;
00445     }
00446     string validList(": ");
00447     for_each(m_variants.begin(), m_variants.begin() + BpCommandPhase::H, PrintoutOption(validList));
00448     ss << validList;
00449 
00450     ReportError(ss);
00451     return res;
00452   };
00453 
00454   BpInterconnect::BpPhaseCommandOptions::~BpPhaseCommandOptions()
00455   {
00456     for_each(m_variants.begin(), m_variants.end(), Destructor());
00457   }

00459   bool BpInterconnect::BpPhaseCommandOptions::LookupOption::_FindOptionMatchBounds(const char* descrToken)
00460   {
00461     string optionStr = string(" -") + descrToken; //prefix with space and dash
00462     size_t pos_opt = m_cmd.find(optionStr);
00463     if (pos_opt == string::npos)
00464       return false;
00465     //check if optionStr in m_cmd is terminated at the string end or followed by space separator
00466     return m_cmd.length() == (pos_opt + optionStr.length()) || m_cmd[pos_opt + optionStr.length()] == ' ';
00467   }

00469   void BpInterconnect::BpPhaseCommandOptions::PrintoutOption::operator ()(OptionsDescriptor *descr)
00470   { 
00471     if (!m_passed_first)
00472     {
00473       m_valid_list += string("-");
00474       m_passed_first = true;
00475     }
00476     else
00477       m_valid_list += string(", -");
00478     m_valid_list += string(descr->GetLongOptionsPtr(0)->name);
00479   };
